content:
From #general: mailing list mirror:

[[JSPL: The following email was sent to the old mailing list by lorenzo@logic.at<mailto:lorenzo@logic.at> while it was offline]]

Hello everyone! We're organizing a one-day conference at TU Wien on
7/Dec/2023, focusing mainly on the connection between logic and other
mathematics.

We have two invited speakers, Julia Wolf (University of Cambridge, UK)
and Ulrich Kohlenbach (TU Darmstadt, Germany).
Now we're looking for contributed speakers and we'd appreciate if you
take into consideration giving a talk at the conference.
The deadline for submitting your presentation proposal (the title and
abstract of your talk) is 7/Nov/2023.

You can see below for more information, but please feel free to send an
email to Lorenzo Sauras-Altuzarra (lorenzo@logic.at<mailto:lorenzo@logic.at>) if you have any
question. Thank you in advance.

Call for Participation

CTLM 2023

Conference on Techniques from Logic in Mathematics

TU Wien, Vienna, Austria -- 7/Dec/2023

https://sites.google.com/view/techniquesfromlogic/home<https://sites.google.com/view/techniquesfromlogic/home>

DESCRIPTION

CTLM 2023 is aimed to enhance the engagement between
domestic researchers/students and external researchers
working in connections between logic and other areas of
mathematics.

REGISTRATION

Given the limited seating capacity of the lecture room, we
kindly request you to register beforehand using the google
form from the conference website. There is no registration
fee!

If you wish to give a contributed talk, you can also submit
your presentation proposal (the title and abstract for your
talk) via the same google form. The deadline for submission
is 7/Nov/2023.

Due to the limited schedule, there might be a selection of
presentation proposals by the scientific committee. The
result will be announced by 23/Nov/2023.

INVITED SPEAKERS

Julia Wolf (University of Cambridge, UK)
Ulrich Kohlenbach (TU Darmstadt, Germany)

SCIENTIFIC COMMITTEE

Stefan Hetzl (TU Wien, Austria)
Michael Pinsker (TU Wien, Austria)
Mihai Prunescu (IMAR, Romania)

Best regards,
Matthias Baaz, Lorenzo Sauras-Altuzarra and Takehiko Gappo
